QuICT.qcda.optimization.topological_cnot package¶

Submodules¶

QuICT.qcda.optimization.topological_cnot.topological_cnot module¶

class QuICT.qcda.optimization.topological_cnot.topological_cnot.Steiner_Tree(n, topo)¶

Bases: object

the Steiner_Tree struct

we use exponent time to construct the exact steiner tree # fix it with a 2-approximation polynomial algorithm

N¶

the number of vertexes in the graph.

Type

int

matrix¶

topological relationship for n vertexes, it is undirected.

Type

n * n boolean matrix

dp¶

dp array to struct the tree. dp[i][j] means the root is i, state is j’s subtree. when subtree contain vertex k, j & (1 << k) != 0

Type

n * 2^n np.array

ST¶

the indexes of vertexes in tree.

Type

list<int>

father¶

the father of vertexes in the tree.

Type

list<int>

sons¶

the son of vertexes in the tree.

Type

list<int>

pre¶

the state which update this state in dp.

Type

np.array<int>

root¶

the root of the tree.

Type

int

build_ST(ST_input: list, lower_bound)¶

build Steiner_Tree with ST_input in it

ST_input[-1] must be the root of the tree.

Parameters

  • ST_input (list<int>) – the indexes of vertexes which should be contained in the tree. ST_input[-1] should be the root.

  • lower_bound (int) – the minimum index of vertexes which can be used

build_STtree(root, state)¶

build the tree with the dp and pre array

Parameters

  • root (int) – the i in dp[i][j]

  • state (int) – the j in dp[i][j]

elimination_above(gauss_elimination: list)¶
elimination_below(gauss_elimination: list)¶

elimination with some rows below ith row and ith column.

Parameters

gauss_elimination (list<int>) – the equations should be changed in the process.

class QuICT.qcda.optimization.topological_cnot.topological_cnot.TopologicalCnot¶

Bases: QuICT.qcda.optimization._optimization.Optimization

optimize the cnot circuit on topological device https://arxiv.org/pdf/1910.14478.pdf

use steiner tree to optimize a cnot circuit on topological device

classmethod run_parameter(cnot_struct, topology)¶

optimize the circuit

Parameters

  • cnot_struct (list<int>) – the struct of cnot circuit

  • topology (list<tuple<int, int>>) – topology of circuit

QuICT.qcda.optimization.topological_cnot.topological_cnot.delete_dfs(now)¶

search for a initial mapping to get better(maybe) topology

in this order, vertex i is not cut in [i, n)

Parameters

now (int) – the index of vertex now

QuICT.qcda.optimization.topological_cnot.topological_cnot.read(circuit, cnot_struct, topology)¶

get describe from the circuit or cnot_struct :param circuit: the input circuit, contained the information of topology and (maybe) cnot :type circuit: Circuit :param cnot_struct: the information of cnot. if None, the information is contained in the circuit :type cnot_struct: list<int> :param topology: topology of circuit, None or empty means fully connected :type topology: list<tuple<int, int>>

Returns

the whole graph of the st list<int>: the inverse of the initial mapping

Return type

Steiner_Tree

main part of the algorithm

Parameters

ST_tree (Steiner_Tree) – the whole graph

Returns

the result of the algorithm

Return type

list<CXGates>
